intro: Draba lapilutea, commonly known as the yellow sandstone saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Draba lapilutea is a hardy species adapted to cold climates and is often found in high-altitude ecosystems.
